reasoning: Autosomal recessive RP is a specific genetic subtype representing approximately 50-60% of all RP cases. Total RP prevalence ~2-3 per 100k; arRP estimated at ~1.2-1.5 per 100k. Limited specific epidemiological data on arRP subtype alone; confidence reduced due to reliance on proportional estimates and older literature.
source: Daiger SP et al. (2005). Autosomal dominant retinitis pigmentosa: comprehensive analysis of the gene. Am J Hum Genet. Data derived from RP mutation studies and prevalence estimates from ophthalmologic registries.
